business.headline: Meet Alakh Pandey, the young Edtech visionary behind Physics WallahFrom a humble tutor to a trailblazing entrepreneur, Alakh Pandey's journey with Physics Wallah shows how passion and perseverance can turn even the simplest beginnings into a $2.8 billion empire—reshaping education, one formula at a time.
Akriti Chopra, Zomato co-founder and Chief People's Officer, resignsIn an email to Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal, Akriti Chopra announced her decision to resign with immediate effect.
Explained: Why SJVN shares gained over 6% todayThe stock rose 6.03% to Rs 133.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with a market capitalisation of Rs 52,520 crore.
Sensex, Nifty end lower after hitting record highs as financial stocks fallThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 264.27 points lower at 85,571.85, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 37.10 points lower at 26,178.95.

Swiggy files for Rs 10,000 crore IPO: Here's all you need to knowSwiggy's IPO will consist of two main parts: a fresh issue of equity shares worth Rs 3,750 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 18.52 crore shares by existing stakeholders.

India once had a Rs 10,000 note. Know why it was discontinuedThe history of India's Rs 10,000 note dates back to the pre-independence era. In 1938, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) issued its first Rs 10,000 note, the largest denomination ever printed in the country.
What are multi-asset funds and are they good for your investment portfolio?Multi-asset funds are schemes that invest in a combination of three or more assets, such as equities, bonds, and gold.
China boosts exports: Will it hurt India, other global markets?With a slowing domestic economy, China is looking to global markets to absorb its excess production.

Real estate multibagger stock soars 260% in 1 year since IPO. Have you invested?Since its debut on the stock exchanges on September 27, 2023, the stock has outperformed not only its peers but also the broader real estate market.
Swipe, spend, struggle: How credit card defaults are spiking in IndiaOnce a symbol of freedom, credit cards now trap young Indians in growing debt. Could defaults be the new norm?

KRN Heat Exchanger IPO: Check latest GMP, subscription status, other detailsKRN Heat Exchanger opened for subscription on September 25 looking to raise Rs 341.95 crore from its public issue, and has already seen bids of over 80 times.

Accenture guidance boost lifts Infosys, Wipro; IT stocks rally up to 4%Accenture not only exceeded market expectations for its Q4 results but also raised its revenue guidance for FY25 to a range of 3-6%.

Will Middle East conflict dampen Dalal Street's rally? Here's what experts say Despite the uncertainty arising from the Middle East conflict, Indian stocks have surged, with benchmarks like the Sensex and Nifty showing strong gains.

Vedanta shares cross Rs 500 mark after gaining 5%. More gains ahead?Vedanta's performance in 2024 has been impressive, with the stock climbing 95% so far this year and gaining 124.35% over the last 12 months. Over a five-year period, the stock has risen by 202%.
Sensex, Nifty close at all-time high led by rally in auto and metal stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 666.25 points to end at 85,836.12, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 211.90 points to close at 26,216.05.
Tata Steel shares gain for 5th straight session. What should investors do?In the past year, Tata Steel has rallied 28%, with an 18% gain so far in 2024.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Hezbollah confirms Hassan Nasrallah's death in Israeli airstrike in BeirutHezbollah confirmed the killing of its leader, Hassan Nasrallah, in a massive Israeli airstrike on the group's headquarters in Beirut, which also claimed the lives of several other commanders, marking a significant blow to the Iran-backed terror outfit.

Operation New Order: Israel says Nasrallah dead, will no longer terrorise world  Live UpdatesHassan Nasrallah, the elusive and secretive Hezbollah chief, was killed in the massive airstrike in Beirut targeting the Hezbollah headquarters.

Terrorism will inevitably invite consequences: India blasts Pakistan at UNExercising its right of reply, India sharply criticised Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif's address at the UN General Assembly, calling his comments on the Kashmir issue a "travesty."

Case against Nirmala Sitharaman over 'extortion' through electoral bonds A complaint against Nirmala Sitharaman and others was filed by one Adarsh Iyer from the Janaadhikara Sangharsha Sanghatane, alleging that extortion was carried out through electoral bonds.

Censorship on OTT: Curbing creativity or supporting sensitivity? Celebs discussWith so much available to watch online, are we fine with the idea of absolute freedom or do we need a body to regulate the content and tell us what is right for us to watch? India Today digital spoke to celebs across the film industry to understand the idea of having censorship on OTT platforms.

Zionist regime hasn't learned: Iran Supreme Leader on Hezbollah chief's killingAfter the Israeli military on Saturday claimed that they had eliminated Hezbollah leader Nasrallah in Beirut airstrikes, Khamenei was moved to a secure location with increased security measures as reported by Al Arabiya News, citing sources.

Sh*t show: China pipe blast shoots poop 33 feet into air, drenches commutersVisuals splashed across social media showed a fountain of human excreta shooting into the air before splatting the window shields of cars in China's Nanning.

The Legend of Maula Jatt: India release of Fawad-Mahira Khan's film stalledFawad Khan and Mahira Khan's The Legend of Maula Jatt India release has been stalled. The movie was scheduled for release in the country on October 2.

Is it better to be overdressed or underdressed? While glamming up, we often face a familiar dilemma: should we go all out and dazzle, or play it cool and understated? Let's find out from experts whether it's better to be overdressed or underdressed.

Kingmakers in 2024: Can 'Others' damage Congress prospects in Haryana?In 2009 and 2019, Haryana's voters gave marginally fractured mandates, with the Congress and the BJP winning 40 seats each respectively, the halfway mark being 46.

Hassan Nasrallah: Vegetable vendor's son who became Israel's mortal enemyRarely seen in public, Hassan Nasrallah was like a phantom who turned Hezbollah into a powerful military and political organisation. Israel targeted him by bombing Hezbollah's headquarters in Beirut. This is how the son of a vegetable vendor became a hero in the Arab world, and how he got marked for death.

3 firing incidents in 24 hours in Delhi, shooters leave gang 'calling card'No injuries were reported in any of the incidents. Police suspect the involvement of various gangs operating in the city, with notes left at each scene claiming responsibility for the shootings.

Watch: Aishwarya Rai touches 'guru' Mani Ratnam's feet at IIFA UtsavamActor Aishwarya Rai touched filmmaker Mani Ratnam's feet at IIFA Utsavam 2024 after presenting him with the Best Director award for Ponniyin Selvan II.  Watch the video of the heartfelt moment here.

Crew-9: Sunita Williams rescue mission to launch tonightOriginally scheduled for September 26, the launch was postponed due to adverse weather conditions caused by Hurricane Helene impacting the Gulf Coast of Florida.

Iran's Khamenei moved to safe location after Hezbollah chief's killing: Report Live UpdatesHassan Nasrallah was killed in a targeted Israeli strike on Iran-backed Hezbollah's headquarters in Beirut. Following the Hezbollah commander's death, reports emerged that Iran's Supreme Leader was taken to a secure location.

After Hassan Nasrallah's death, Hezbollah vows to continue its jihad against IsraelIsraeli Airstrikes On Hezbollah Live Updates: The Israel Defence Forces (IDF) on Saturday confirmed that it killed Hezbollah chief Hassan Nasrallah during its massive strikes on the group's headquarters in Beirut's southern suburbs. It said it would continue to strike anyone who would threaten Israel and its citizens. Israel and Hezbollah launched tit-for-tat strikes as the news of Nasrallah's death was confirmed by Israel. Hezbollah's al-Manar television reported that four buildings were destroyed and there were many casualties in the multiple strikes, marking a major escalation of Israel's conflict with the Iran-backed group in 11 months. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu also cut short a visit to the US and was returning home. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Indian-American CEO's witty reply to X user who called him 'untrained engineer'Nikesh Arora, an Indian-American business executive, gave a witty reply to a user on X who claimed he wasn't a trained engineer.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Hezbollah chief Hassan Nasrallah's daughter killed in Beirut airstrike: ReportIsrael-Hezbollah war: There has been no official confirmation either by Israel or Lebanon of the death of Zainab Nasrallah.

BookMyShow on Coldplay concert ticketing issue: We ensured every fan a fair chanceBookMyShow addresses concerns over the black market sale of Coldplay tickets, clarifying its fair ticketing measures. It also stated that it has no association with any unauthorised ticket-selling platforms.

Rajinikanth says 'sorry' when asked to comment on Tirupati laddu rowSuperstar Rajinikanth met reporters outside an airport and refused to react to the ongoing Tirupati laddu controversy. The actor kept walking and ignored the serious questions.

Blundell, Phillips hold fort for NZ, after Prabath Jayasuriya runs riot on Day 3New Zealand are staring down at a 0-2 series defeat against Sri Lanka as they were reeling at 199/5 at stumps on Day 3 of the second Test at Galle International Stadium, Galle.

Pooran achieved this feat playing for various teams, including Trinbago Knight Riders and West Indies.

ECB's financial projections for The Hundred is disconnected from reality: LalitLalit Modi, the brain behind the successful IPL, has expressed serious doubts about the ECB's financial projections for 'The Hundred'. He believes the numbers are overly optimistic and disconnected from reality.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
